message.content:
Oxalis dillenii is a species of herbaceous plant that belongs to the Oxalidaceae family.

It has a deep yellowish-green foliage with slender stems and triangular leaves that are usually arranged in groups of three.

The leaves have a smooth texture and a glossy surface in some cases.

The plant has small white, pink, or yellow flowers that bloom in small clusters above the foliage, making it an attractive ornamental plant.

The leaves also have a sour or tangy taste that is often used as a medicinal herb for its high content of vitamin C and antioxidant properties.

Oxalis dillenii is commonly found across North America in meadows, pastures, open woods and disturbed areas.

The plant is known for its ability to survive in a variety of soil and climatic conditions, making it a versatile and hardy plant.
